title: Decide what to do with bmad-master YAML config
description:
The upstream bmad-master.agent.yaml contains structured config that doesn't map to Claude Code agent format:

1. menu: trigger/action pairs (e.g., "LT" → list tasks from task-manifest.csv)
2. critical_actions: greeting text with /bmad-help reference
3. persona.hasSidecar: false
4. metadata.id: file path reference

Our generate-agents.ts converts this to plugins/bmad/agents/bmad-master.md, keeping role, identity, communication_style, principles as markdown. But the menu system, critical_actions, and sidecar config are lost.

Decision needed:
(a) Accept the loss — these features don't translate to Claude Code's agent model
(b) Embed the menu/critical_actions in the agent markdown as instructions
(c) Create a separate YAML config that the agent references at runtime

Recommendation: Option (a) — the menu system (LT, LW triggers) is IDE-specific and doesn't apply to Claude Code's slash command model. Our /bmad:help and /bmad:status skills already cover this functionality. Close as wontfix with documentation of what was intentionally dropped.

Files for reference:
- .upstream/BMAD-METHOD/src/core/agents/bmad-master.agent.yaml (upstream YAML)
- plugins/bmad/agents/bmad-master.md (our converted agent)
- scripts/generate-agents.ts (conversion logic)

title: Fix Last synced date: only update when upstream version actually changes
description:
scripts/update-readme-version.ts always sets Last synced to today's date, even when the upstream version hasn't changed. After bmp-t5o creates the multi-source table, each row will have its own Last Synced column.

Fix: Only update a source's "Last Synced" date when its .upstream-version-* file content actually changed.

Approach (recommended): Use git log to find when each version file was last modified:
  git log -1 --format=%ai -- .upstream-version-core | cut -d' ' -f1

This gives the date of the last commit that touched the version file. No extra tracking files needed.

Alternative: Compare version before/after in the script, but this only works during a single run and doesn't handle historical dates.

Files to modify:
- scripts/update-readme-version.ts — use git log date for each source's Last Synced column

Depends on: bmp-t5o (table format must exist first)

title: Update sync workflow to auto-update module badges
description:
The sync workflow (.github/workflows/sync-upstream.yml) has 5 jobs: check-core, check-tea, check-bmb, check-cis, check-gds. Only check-core has an "Update badge JSON" step (lines 41-56). The other 4 jobs are missing badge updates.

Fix: Add a badge update step to each of check-tea, check-bmb, check-cis, check-gds, following the same pattern as check-core.

Pattern (from check-core lines 41-56):
  - name: Update badge JSON
    if: steps.compare.outputs.changed == 'true'
    run: |
      cat > .github/badges/upstream-version-{id}.json <<EOF
      { "schemaVersion": 1, "label": "{Label} Module", "message": "$UPSTREAM", "color": "blue" }
      EOF
      git config user.name "github-actions[bot]" ...
      git add ... && git commit ... && git push

Badge files and labels:
- check-tea → .github/badges/upstream-version-tea.json, label "TEA Module"
- check-bmb → .github/badges/upstream-version-bmb.json, label "BMB Module"
- check-cis → .github/badges/upstream-version-cis.json, label "CIS Module"
- check-gds → .github/badges/upstream-version-gds.json, label "GDS Module"

Also: core badge (.github/badges/upstream-version.json) currently shows "v6.0.0-Beta.4" (stale) — update it to v6.0.0-Beta.7 as part of this change.

Files to modify:
